question: How do I configure DNS servers on Arch Linux?

golden_answer.summary: Configure DNS in /etc/resolv.conf (systemd-resolved) or /etc/systemd/resolved.conf, depending on your network manager.
steps: Check current DNS method: systemctl status systemd-resolved
Add DNS servers: DNS=8.8.8.8 1.1.1.1 under [Resolve] section
Restart systemd-resolved: sudo systemctl restart systemd-resolved
Test DNS: dig google.com or nslookup google.com
warnings: If using NetworkManager or dhcpcd, they may override DNS settings
/etc/resolv.conf is often a symlink - check what it points to
systemd-resolved and other DNS managers can conflict - use one method
Changes to /etc/resolv.conf may be overwritten - use resolved.conf instead
